Author: ca333#0118
Content: yes - this regex looks "good" - however, for your info: if i remember correctly i had cases where the regex returned true BUT a base58 validateaddress() returned false. I personally always advice against regex checks for address validations - but in our case (since its just a explorer query) we can do it to prevent you from integrating 3rd party base58 library.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Ok, for the moment i stay with the regex

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: once we have a proof of concept that work, we will look for the details

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: addresses last 4 bytes are checksum, so even if valid chars very few that pass the regex are valid addresses

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Yes but in practice, I use regex only to filter the type of input, then if someone searches for an incorrect address, it will just get an error.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Only to know if I potentially have an address, a block, a blockhash, a transaction

Author: ca333#0118
Content: yes for now thats fine - once we get into details we can optimize the API query "pre-filter"

Author: Slyris#2880
Content:
AS final structure for price i suggest:

```go
type TickerInformation struct {
    ID                string    `json:"id"`
    Name              string    `json:"name"`
    Symbol            string    `json:"symbol"`
    Rank              int       `json:"rank"`
    CirculatingSupply int       `json:"circulating_supply"`
    TotalSupply       int       `json:"total_supply"`
    MaxSupply         int       `json:"max_supply"`
    BetaValue         float64   `json:"beta_value"`
    LastUpdated       time.Time `json:"last_updated"`
    Quotes            struct {
        USD struct {
            Price               float64   `json:"price"`
            Volume24H           float64   `json:"volume_24h"`
            Volume24HChange24H  float64   `json:"volume_24h_change_24h"`
            MarketCap           int64     `json:"market_cap"`
            MarketCapChange24H  float64   `json:"market_cap_change_24h"`
            PercentChange1H     float64   `json:"percent_change_1h"`
            PercentChange12H    float64   `json:"percent_change_12h"`
            PercentChange24H    float64   `json:"percent_change_24h"`
            PercentChange7D     float64   `json:"percent_change_7d"`
            PercentChange30D    float64   `json:"percent_change_30d"`
            PercentChange1Y     float64   `json:"percent_change_1y"`
            AthPrice            int       `json:"ath_price"`
            AthDate             time.Time `json:"ath_date"`
            PercentFromPriceAth float64   `json:"percent_from_price_ath"`
        } `json:"USD"`
    } `json:"quotes"`
}
```

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
In addition to the market infos and last blockhash lets also add:

```
"blocks": 1442348,
"notarized": 1442330,
"notarizedhash": "00000000bf1b83fd71b1dabe7d0c9e2d5401f69d9df492f42e1ab0ad52fdcbd9",
"notarizedtxid": "4f7fd6a5905a93ac443dce7f4df932ce72a638afe45db8862d6774cecff8fb11",
```

When you pull these infos always ensure that the node we pull it from has `connections>2` (to ensure the node is "online" and knows about the current network stats) and `blocks==longestchain (to ensure the node is synced) - if this conditions are not met the node is likely still syncing or "offline" or so..

Author: Slyris#2880
Slyris#2880
Content: if sync percentage is equal to 100 we can assume that the node is synced ?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: and if the status is finished ?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: like `nodeIsSynced = (status == "finished") && (syncPercentage == "100")` ?

Author: Slyris#2880
ca333#0118
Content: i believe `currentCoin.NodeIsSynced = node.Status == "finished" && node.BlockChainHeight == node.Height` would be more appropriate since `node.SyncPercentage` likely is not precise enough.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Ok !

Content: I fix that and push it üòÉ

Author: ca333#0118
Content: everyone This is the "Antara Coin Cap" project channel - we built a prototype backend to create a "coinmarketcap" clone for Komodo ecosystem coins (smart chains). We are now looking for a web/frontend dev to build a realtime webapp based on a theme like https://coreui.io/demo/dark/#main.html - what we envision is a web-application similar to coinmarketcap with all relevant infos of a coin and in addition we also show a few blockchain infos (realtime stats) like current height, dPoW status, etc. ON the landing page list - and when someone clicks on a specific chain the detail-view is shown with all available infos. The API documentation and source code are pinned. If you are interested in this task or have questions please contact me or @Slyris through DM.
